Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Stem Cell Therapy for Myocardial Regeneration

Trial_Design.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence

Participants.evidence: Participants with ischemic cardiac injury and NYHA class I-III symptoms were eligible.

Intervention.evidence: The intervention group received 150 million autologous BM MSCs, 5 million c-kit+ CPCs, or both via transendocardial injection. The control group received PlasmaLyte A.

Objective.evidence: To assess the impact of stem cell therapy on cardiac function.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the change in left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) over six months.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation was performed using a computer-generated sequence with allocation concealment via sealed envelopes.

Blinding.evidence: Blinding included outcome assessors and patients.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 144 participants were randomised

Result_Outcome.evidence: LVEF changes were not significantly different between groups. However, major adverse cardiac events decreased significantly in the CPC group (p = 0.043).

Harms.evidence: No severe adverse events were reported.

Funding.evidence: Supported by the National Institutes of Health.
